. Earlier on Sunday, Barack Obama Kirsten Gillibrand told US television that she had visited with Gabrielle Giffords the previous day and found her "doing great" and "making progress every day." Gabrielle Giffords is using both sides of her body. She's able to breathe on her own. She's able to open her eyes and to show people she understands what she's hearing and seeing, Kirsten Gillibrand told NBC's Meet The Press program. "It's an extraordinary amount of progress for a woman who sustained such a horrific injury," she added. The 40-year-old Gabrielle Giffords has survived

playoffs since 2006 and has never won a postseason game. The Grizzlies are coming off a 24-58 season that tied for fifth-worst in the NBA. "This year for me is so personal," Allen Iverson said. It's basically going to be my rookie season again. It hurts, but I turn the TV on, I read the paper, I listen to some of the things people say about me having the season that I had last year and me losing a step, things like that. They're trying to put me in a rocking chair already. The Grizzlies announced they had signed the 10-time All Star on Thursday morning minutes before Allen Iverson was introduced at a news conference. 26 percent to$ 8.44 billion, compared to the same period last year. Net income for the quarter was$ 2.54 billion, compared to$ 1.97 billion in the fourth quarter of 2009. Our strong performance has been driven by a rapidly growing digital economy, continuous product innovation that benefits both users and advertisers, and by the extraordinary momentum of our newer businesses, such as display and mobile, said Eric Schmidt , chief executive of Google. "These results give us the optimism and confidence to invest heavily in future growth-- investments that will benefit our users, Google and the wider web."
